definitions.definition: a person who writes books or the person who wrote a particular book

examples.text: He is the author of three books on art.
According to report author Matt Blaze, the technique requires no special skill.
Really quick **author's note**: This is the last chapter of the story.
The film is based on a novel written by a French author.
The report's authors point to a recent study of American college students.
Her ambition was to become a published author.
Primarily a children's author, she has also written books for adults.
Stephen King is an author I've never read.
The study's authors conclude that there is insufficient evidence to justify the policy.
the anonymous author of this pamphlet

definitions.definition: the person who creates or starts something, especially a plan or an idea

examples.text: As the author of the proposal I cannot agree with you.
He is the author of a plan to bring peace to the region.

wordOrigin: Middle English (in the sense ‘a person who invents or causes something’): from Old French autor, from Latin auctor, from augere ‘increase, originate, promote’. The spelling with th arose in the 15th cent., and perhaps became established under the influence of authentic.
